thread.title: Houston man sentenced in child porn case
thread.title_full: Houston man sentenced in child porn case

author: Mike Glenn, Houston Chronicle
title: Houston man sentenced in child porn case
text:
By Mike Glenn , Houston Chronicle Updated 5:16 pm, Tuesday, February 21, 2017 Photo: Harris County Sheriff's Office Image 1 of / 1 Close Image 1 of 1 
Joshua Harrison Bishnow, 26, was sentenced to eight years in prison for possession of child pornography on Feb. 20, 2017. 
Joshua Harrison Bishnow, 26, was sentenced to eight years in prison for possession of child pornography on Feb. 20, 2017. Photo: Harris County Sheriff's Office Houston man sentenced in child porn case 1 / 1 


A repair technician found "numerous" examples of child pornography in June 2016 after a Houston man took his iPhone in to the shop to get a new screen, authorities said. 
On Monday, the Houston man, Joshua Harrison Bishnow, 26, was sentenced in 248 Harris County District Court to eight years in prison after pleading guilty to three counts of possession of child pornography. 
The repair technician notified Harris County sheriff's deputies after making the discovery. They were there when Bishnow returned to pick up his iPhone, authorities said. 
At the time, Bishnow denied placing any explicit material on the phone, which was retained as evidence. 
Detectives later served a search warrant at his home and seized a laptop and several computer servers where several hundred examples of child pornography, including videos, were recovered. 
Bishnow is currently awaiting transfer to the custody of the Texas Department of Criminal Justice, officials said.
